method: Fill a small pan just over one third full with cold water and bring it to the boil. Add the vinegar and turn down to simmer. Crack the eggs one at a time into a small bowl and gently tip into the simmering water. Lightly poach for 3-4 minutes. Remove with a slotted spoon and drain on kitchen towels. Season with salt and freshly ground black pepper and serve immediately.
ingredients: 1 tbsp white wine vinegar,  2 free-range eggs,  salt and freshly ground black pepper
